Ecclesiasticus *__49.1: The memory of Josias is like the composition of a sweet smell made by the art of a perfumer:
Ecclesiasticus *__49.2: His remembrance shall be sweet as honey in every mouth, and as music at a banquet of wine.
Ecclesiasticus *__49.3: He was directed by God unto the repentance of the nation, and he took away the abominations of wickedness.
Ecclesiasticus *__49.4: And he directed his heart towards the Lord, and in the days of sinners he strengthened godliness.
Ecclesiasticus *__49.5: Except David, and Ezechias, and Josias, all committed sin.
Ecclesiasticus *__49.6: For the kings of Juda forsook the law of the most High, and despised the fear of God.
Ecclesiasticus *__49.7: So they gave their kingdom to others, and their glory to a strange nation.
Ecclesiasticus *__49.8: They burnt the chosen city of holiness, and made the streets thereof desolate according to the prediction of Jeremias.
Ecclesiasticus *__49.9: For they treated him evil, who was consecrated a prophet from his mother's womb, to overthrow, and pluck up, and destroy, and to build again, and renew.
Ecclesiasticus *__49.10: It was Ezechiel that saw the glorious vision, which was shewn him upon the chariot of cherubims.
Ecclesiasticus *__49.11: For he made mention of the enemies under the figure of rain, and of doing good to them that shewed right ways.
Ecclesiasticus *__49.12: And may the bones of the twelve prophets spring up out of their place: for they strengthened Jacob, and redeemed themselves by strong faith.
Ecclesiasticus *__49.13: How shall we magnify Zorobabel? for he was as a signet on the right hand;
Ecclesiasticus *__49.14: In like manner Jesus the son of Josedec? who in their days built the house, and set up a holy temple to the Lord, prepared for everlasting glory.
Ecclesiasticus *__49.15: And let Nehemias be a long time remembered, who raised up for us our walls that were cast down, and set up the gates and the bars, who rebuilt our houses.
Ecclesiasticus *__49.16: No man was born upon earth like Henoch: for he also was taken up from the earth.
Ecclesiasticus *__49.17: Nor as Joseph, who was a man born prince of his brethren, the support of his family, the ruler of his brethren, the stay of the people:
Ecclesiasticus *__49.18: And his bones were visited, and after death <u>they prophesied</u>.
Ecclesiasticus *__49.19: Seth and Sem obtained glory among men: and above every soul Adam in the beginning.
